articles.title: DPRK's Satellite Launch Not Contradictory to DPRK-U.S. Agreement: KCNA
articles.content:
DPRK's Satellite Launch Not Contradictory to DPRK-U.S. Agreement: KCNA
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet forces are busy with an odd smear campaign over the issue of DPRK's launch of Kwangmyongsong-3.
					Afloat on Saturday alone were rumors aimed to disturb negotiations between the DPRK and the U.S. 
					
					Dong-A Ilbo said "the north reduced the north Korea-U.S. agreement to a scrap of paper in 15 days". Kukmin Ilbo asserted "this is little short of violating the agreement reached at the DPRK-U.S. high-level talks even before the ink of their signature was dry" and KBS noted "this showed the north's will to take initiative, while boosting its negotiating power", etc.
					
					Then why are they claiming the satellite to be launched by the DPRK is an inter-continental ballistic missile and it is a violation of the agreement reached at the DPRK-U.S. high-level talks on February 29? 
					
					This can be explained by the political aims sought by the Lee Myung Bak "government" nearing its end.
					
					The Lee group cannot but feel afraid of the results of dialogue and negotiations between the DPRK and U.S. more than anything else. It is seized with uneasiness for fear that it may be forsaken by its master, finding itself with no one to relay on, and may be elbowed out even in the discussion of the regional issues.
					
					It was against this backdrop that the puppet forces seized the DPRK's announcement of its projected launch of satellite as a golden chance to egg the U.S. neo-conservative forces on to drive the DPRK-U.S. talks into a collapse and cling again to the coattails of their U.S. master.
					
					This can be proved by their unusual propaganda claiming that "the DPRK's satellite launch is a provocative plan contrary to the points agreed upon between the north and the U.S." and "the possibility of dialogue and negotiations is doubtful."
					
					This is no more than a petty trick of the stupid and ignorant guys.
					
					Explicitly speaking, the DPRK's launch of satellite has nothing to do with the above-said agreement.
					
					The DPRK has already decided to put moratorium on nuclear test, long-range missile launch and uranium enrichment in Nyongbyon while fruitful talks are under way and allow the IAEA to monitor it.
					
					It opened to the public its plan for the launch on the basis of the legitimate rights of all countries to use outer space for peaceful purposes and sent necessary information to international organizations according to the international regulations and procedures.
					
					The DPRK's plan for satellite launch poses no problem as it is prompted by its noble desire to put the country's up-to-the-minute science and technology on a higher level and thus reinforce the mainstay for building a socialist power and make a contribution to prosperity of the Korean nation and that common to humankind.
					
					The launch of the working satellite is an issue fundamentally different from that of a long-range missile.
					
					More than 100 space vehicles are put into the orbit around the earth by carrier rockets in a year on an average worldwide. How can the puppet and other hostile forces explain this fact.
					
					High vigilance is required against their false propaganda.
					
					In the past, the hostile forces floated story about "suspected uranium enrichment" in a bid to scuttle the DPRK-U.S. dialogue and render the situation extremely tense and this compelled the DPRK to have access to nukes. This lesson taught by history should not be forgotten.
					
					The DPRK's sovereignty and right to existence can be firmly guaranteed by itself.

articles.title: Greetings to Tunisian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Tunisian President
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greeting to Al Moncef Al Marzouki, president of Tunisia, on its national day.
					In the message Kim wished the president greater success in his work for the country's social stability and economic development and expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future.

articles.title: Greetings to Tunisian PM
articles.content:
Greetings to Tunisian PM
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim Monday sent a message of greeting to Hamadi Jebali, prime minister of Tunisia, on its national day.
					The message wished the prime minister success in his work for economic development of the country and well-being of its people.
					
					On the same day, Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a similar message to his Tunisian counterpart Rafik Abdessalem.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Learns about Work in Different Fields in Chongjin City
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Learns about Work in Different Fields in Chongjin City
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim learned about the work in different fields in Chongjin City, North Hamgyong Province on March 16 and 17. Among them were the Ranam Coal Mining Machine Complex, the Chongjin Steel Works, the Susongchon Combined Foodstuff Factory and the Namsok Co-op Farm in Songphyong District.
					While going round different units now alive with the labor drive in response to the flames of Hamnam, the premier acquainted himself in detail with the production of custom-built equipment and irons and steels, technological updating, quality of foodstuff and preparations for immediate farming.
					
					The officials and other working people in the city are bringing about a surge in production and construction to honor their pledge they made before the bier of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					The premier encouraged the workers at the relevant units in their labor drive and took measures to boost production.
					
					He convened a consultative meeting of officials concerned on the basis of his survey of economic affairs in the city.
					
					The meeting discussed practical matters for sprucing up the city as a modern city and improving the standard of the people's living.
					
					It took measures to put the material-supply plan on par with production plan, organize the supply of fuel, raw materials and electricity in a reasonable manner, step up the modernization of railways and increase freight turnover.

articles.title: Unhasu Orchestra Back Home
articles.content:
Unhasu Orchestra Back Home
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The Unhasu Orchestra led by Kwon Hyok Bong, advisor to the Korean Traditional Music Institute, Monday returned home Monday after co-performing with Radio Philharmonic Orchestra of France in Paris.

articles.title: Art Performance Given by Successful Entrants for Vocal and Musical Instrument Solo Competition
articles.content:
Art Performance Given by Successful Entrants for Art Competition
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- An art performance was given by successful entrants for art competition among primary organizations of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea at the Central Hall of Workers Monday to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					Narration and song "Let's Sing of the Day of the Sun", poem recital and song "Our Unforgettable Leader", oungum ensemble "Country of the Leader" and other numbers impressively represented boundless reverence for Kim Il Sung who showed profound loving care for the workers.
					
					Also put on the stage were numbers singing of the workers who are enjoying a worthwhile life in the grateful socialist system.
					
					Among the audience were trade union officials and members in Pyongyang.

articles.title: Upcoming Satellite Launch, Big Pride for DPRK
articles.content:
Upcoming Satellite Launch, Big Pride for DPRK
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Korean Committee for Space Technology in a statement Friday declared that the Democratic People's Republic of Korea would launch Kwangmyongsong-3, an earth observation satellite, to mark the 100th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					The statement instills into the minds of the people in the DPRK a pride in living in a satellite manufacturing and launching state.
					
					Hong Son Ok, vice-chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, told KCNA:
					
					"The statement represents the DPRK's will to deepen international trust and cooperation in research into space technology and satellite launch. The earth observation satellite will be launched with success, in reflection of the DPRK desire for peaceful use of the space.
					
					Now I am recalling the tireless efforts leader Kim Jong Il had devoted to developing local space science and technology."
					
					A department director of the Committee, Ryu Kyong Il, said:
					
					"The news of upcoming launch of a working satellite has greatly delighted us.
					
					On March 15, a photo exhibition co-sponsored by KCNA and AP of the United States was opened in New York to mark Kim Il Sung's 100th birth anniversary.
					
					The Unhasu Orchestra, famous at home and abroad, had a joint concert with the Radio Philharmonic Orchestra of France in Paris.
					
					DPRK girls finished first in the Under-19 International Women Soccer (Spring of Kuban) held in Russia.
					
					All these facts illustrate that the DPRK has been under the world's spotlight."

articles.title: New Documentaries Produced in DPRK
articles.content:
New Documentaries Produced in DPRK
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Parts 2 and 3 of documentaries "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il will be immortal" were produced in the DPRK.
					Part 2 "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il will always live in the hearts of the nation" shows overseas Koreans and south Koreans in grief over his demise.
					
					A memorial service of Koreans in Japan took place solemnly in Japan and memorial services in Osaka and all other prefectural headquarters.
					
					During the mourning days Choson Sinbo and other publications of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) conveyed in detail the undying feats he performed, reflecting the grief of the fellow countrymen.
					
					Koreans in China visited mourning stations at the DPRK embassy, the consulate general and other places in China and expressed profound sorrow, looking back on the footsteps left by him in different parts of China.
					
					Koreans in Russia visited the mourning stations at the DPRK embassy in Moscow and the DPRK consulate general in Nakhodka and deeply grieved over his demise. 
					
					Koreans in Uzbekistan, Germany and other countries expressed deep condolences over his demise. Koreans in the U.S. also expressed condolences.
					
					During the mourning days overseas Koreans came to the homeland to visit his bier. Many letters and messages of condolences were sent by overseas compatriots organizations and compatriots.
					
					Incense-burning altars were set up in different parts of south Korea. South Koreans waged a struggle to visit his bier and many reunification movement organizations, civic and public organizations and religious organizations released mourning statements and sent messages of condolences. Media devoted space and programs to conveying news of mourning events. 
					
					A total of more than 120 000 articles mourning his demise were posted on Internet sites in one hour after the sad news was reported.
					
					Hwang Hye Ro, co-representative of the Korea Solidarity for Independent Reunification and Democracy, Ri Hui Ho, widow of former south Korean President Kim Dae Jung, Hyon Jong Un, chairwoman of Hyundai Group, and their parties and the mourners group of the World Peace Federation led by President Moon Hyung Jin visited Pyongyang.
					
					Part 3 "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il will always live in the hearts of mankind" deals with historic facts that hundreds of millions of people in the world mourned his demise in the humblest reverence.
					
					More than 3 000 messages of condolences were sent by party, state and government heads, political parties, public organizations and high-ranking officials of political, public, military and economic circles of more than 120 countries and representatives of international organizations, Juche idea study organizations and friendship and solidarity organizations during the mourning period.
					
					At least 190 countries, the UN and other international organizations and even those countries which are hostile to the DPRK expressed profound condolences over his demise. Condolatory visits of party, state and government heads, hoisting of flags at half mast and other events took place solemnly.
					
					In China alone senior officials and officials of party, state and army of more than 2 000 units and people from all walks of life paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy and consulate general.
					
					At least 10 000 media of more than 150 countries and regions in the world carried special write-ups every day over his demise with flash news hour by hour, breaking the precedent in reporting about the events of mourning the death of foreign heads of state.
					
					Foreign media gave wide publicity to his brief biography and greatness with portraits of smiling Kim Jong Il and portraits of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, the building of a thriving socialist nation, the DPRK which suffered the great loss and news of mourning events in many countries of the world.

articles.title: Pictorial on Kim Jong Il Published
articles.content:
Pictorial on Kim Jong Il Published
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- A pictorial "Images of Nation's Father" was published recently by the Pyongyang Publishing House.
					A picture of smiling leader Kim Jong Il is carried in its front page. The pictorial contains photos featuring Kim Jong Il, who was devoting his all to the people with a strong sense of patriotism.
					
					It also carries photos of Kim Jong Il meeting south Korean people and overseas compatriots.
					
					Gifts presented to him by south Koreans and overseas Koreans were also pictured in it.
					
					The pictorial breaks into three parts.

articles.title: Mass Art Activities Brisk in DPRK
articles.content:
Mass Art Activities Brisk in DPRK
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The mass art activities are brisk in the DPRK.
					This movement helps improve the cultural level of citizens and make the whole society permeated with optimism and vigor.
					
					The Workers' Party of Korea has long paid big efforts to it after setting forth the policy of popularizing art.
					
					Whenever giving field guidance to different units President Kim Il Sung appreciated their art groups' performances so as to make the people creators and enjoyers of art.
					
					The DPRK's mass art activities greeted a new golden age of development under the wise guidance of Kim Jong Il.
					
					Leader Kim Jong Il initiated the performance of art groups of servicemen's wives and made it a tradition.
					
					Whenever visiting industrial establishments and co-op farms, he enjoyed art pieces presented by soldiers and civilians and gave them precious teachings for further developing their artistic activities.
					
					The national singing contest of working people and performances of art groups at ministries and national institutions well represent the true picture of the developing mass art in the DPRK.
					
					Some days ago an Unhasu concert took place in Pyongyang to mark the International Women's Day. At the concert some of the audience joined its performers at their request, among them couples of senior party and military officials. Through their successful performance they displayed the vitality of mass art in the Songun (military-first) era.

articles.title: Commemorative Stamp Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
Commemorative Stamp Issued in DPRK
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea issued a stamp in commemoration of the 95th anniversary of the Korean National Association (KNA).
					The KNA was formed in Haktanggol of Pyongyang on Mar. 23, Juche 6 (1917) by Kim Hyong Jik, prominent leader of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement in Korea.
					
					As an underground organization, its object was to achieve the independence of Korea by united effort of the entire nation and build a genuine civilized country.
					
					It was one of the biggest anti-Japanese revolutionary organizations formed by Korean patriots at home and abroad before and after the March First Popular Uprising (1919).
					
					Printed on the stamp are Korean letters "Commemoration of the KNA 95th Birthday", "March 23, 1917", Chinese characters "Jiwon" (aim high) and a picture of the monument to Kim Hyong Jik's feats at the Haktanggol Revolutionary Site.
					
					Meanwhile, the State Stamp Bureau issued stamps on Korean cultural heritages, which show ceramics dating back to the Koryo Kingdom (918-1392) and the Ri Dynasty (1392-1910).

articles.title: DPRK to Attend Taekwon-Do Championships
articles.content:
DPRK to Attend Taekwon-Do Championships
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea is planning to attend the 6th Asian Taekwon-Do Championship due in April in Tajikistan and the 10th World Juvenile Taekwon-Do Championship and the 5th World Veteran Taekwon-Do Championship in August in Estonia.
					Players and coaches of the DPRK team are now busy with training.
					
					Hwang Yong Mi, deputy head of the National Taekwon-Do Team, told KCNA that most of the appointees lack experience in international tournaments.
					
					The DPRK won lots of gold medals in preceding Asian Taekwon-Do Championships and World Juvenile Taekwon-Do Championships.

articles.title: DPRK Men's Soccer Team Wins Title of 2012 AFC Challenger Cup
articles.content:
DPRK Men's Soccer Team Wins Title of 2012 AFC Challenger Cup
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The DPRK men's soccer team beat its Turkmen rival 2:1 in the finals on Mar. 19 to win the title of 2012 AFC Challenger Cup.
					The DPRK team has won the berth to the 2015 Asian Cup.

articles.title: KCNA Blasts Lee Myung Bak's Impudent Remarks
articles.content:
KCNA Blasts Lee Myung Bak's Impudent Remarks
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak is going so shameless as to talk nonsense about the DPRK's announcement of satellite launch.
					The emergency meeting of ministers of diplomacy and defense sponsored by Lee at Chongwadae on March 19 termed the DPRK's projected launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3 a "grave provocation," revealing its attempt to internationalize this issue with the "nuclear security summit" as a momentum.
					
					It is ridiculous, indeed, for the group of Lee, a top class nuclear war servant of the U.S., to find fault with the legitimate satellite launch of fellow countrymen in the north. It is no more than another disgusting act of treachery as it is aimed at escalating the confrontation with fellow countrymen, regarding foreign forces as more important than the nation and acting as their stooges.
					
					All the Koreans at home and abroad are hailing the news of the DPRK's projected satellite launch as a great jubilee of the nation and fervently supporting it.
					
					The launch of Kwangmyongsong-3 will mark a historic occasion of proving that the DPRK's space science and technology has made another big stride and its might has been put onto a higher stage.
					
					It is against this background that Lee Myung Bak is going reckless to do harm to fellow countrymen in league with foreign forces, crying out for "coping with the north's satellite launch through international cooperation". This is another act of treachery.
					
					Clear is what the group is seeking in desperately finding fault with the DPRK's satellite launch for peaceful purposes.
					
					It is as clear as noonday that the satellite launch will help raise the DPRK's international prestige and focus the mindset of south Koreans on the north. This cannot but be a serious blow at the group keen to stifle fellow countrymen with the help of outside forces.
					
					The puppet group failed in two attempts to launch a satellite with the help of outside forces. It would have been better if the group had asked the fellow countrymen of the DPRK to launch it. If it had done so, it could have heard others say that it had maintained national identity.
					
					It is the only preoccupation of the group to do harm to fellow countrymen. Whoever has the soul of the nation even a bit will not dare commit such despicable treachery as malignantly slandering the satellite launch of fellow countrymen.
					
					Lee's intention to take issue with the DPRK's satellite launch with a summit as a momentum clearly proves that he is a pro-U.S. lackey and maniac hell-bent on confrontation with fellow countrymen, utterly indifferent to the dignity and interests of the nation.
					
					The Korean nation can live in peace only when Lee, the root cause of misfortunes and disasters, is ousted as early as possible.

articles.title: "Kim Il Sung's Korea", Special Write-ups to Centenary of His Birth (4)
articles.content:
"Kim Il Sung's Korea", Special Write-ups to Centenary of His Birth (4)
Guerrilla Warfare Based on Ideological and Moral, Strategic and Tactical Superiority
					 
					
					Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The Korean People's Revolutionary Army (KPRA) had only some 100 members when it was organized and thus the Japanese imperialists asserted that the KPRA was "a drop in the ocean".
					
					However, it triumphed over the huge Japanese army equipped with modern weapons. The key to its victory was its ideological and moral superiority.
					
					In summer of Juche 25 (1936) the commander of a Chinese nationalist anti-Japanese unit asked President Kim Il Sung about how the KPRA was winning victory after victory in battles with the bellicose Japanese army. 
					
					The President told him that spirit was more important than tactics.
					
					Judging that the victory in the anti-Japanese war depends on the ideological and mental state of the KPRA members, he had attached great importance to training them to be strong in ideology, faith and grip and optimistic about their victory from the early days of the armed struggle.
					
					The Korean people still recall the historic "Arduous March", made by the main unit of the KPRA under the command of Kim Il Sung from December 1938 to March next year to advance into the area bordering Korea from Nanpaizi of China and save the Korean revolution from crisis.
					
					During the march, the Japanese imperialists attacked the unit tenaciously from all sides with the mobilization of hundreds of thousands of troops and even flying corps.
					
					On the other hand, they tried to disintegrate the unit from within by employing every means.
					
					Under such grim situation the unit had to fight fierce battles with the enemy coming in attack desperately every day.
					
					To make matters worse, food ran out in the severe cold coupled with heavy snowfall.
					
					However, the KPRA members, not losing courage, overcame all the difficulties with their fortitude and indomitable revolutionary spirit.
					
					In the days of the bloody anti-Japanese war, they defended the revolutionary headquarters with their very lives.
					
					One of them silenced the enemy's pillbox with his body to make a breach of the units. Another member kept the revolutionary principles despite all sorts of tortures by the enemy, even biting his own tongue and a woman guerrilla shouted, though she lost her two eyes to the enemy's torture, that the victory of the Korean revolution was in sight.
					
					The DPRK owes the spiritual heritage to this anti-Japanese revolutionary tradition.
					
					The President also effectively applied the Juche-based tactics to leading the guerrilla warfare to victory.
					
					He regarded the protean guerrilla tactics as an important guarantee for the victory in the anti-Japanese armed struggle, advancing the principles and methods of guerrilla warfare and guiding the KPRA to successfully use them in battles.
					
					In those days he created such tactics as allurement and ambush and marching hundreds of miles at one go. 
					
					The Japanese imperialists admitted that the KPRA's war tactics could never be found in their books on military science and tactics. 
					
					The anti-Japanese armed struggle developed the KPRA into an invincible army superior in mental strength and war tactics and defeated the formidable aggressor army warfare with guerrilla warfare.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Policy of Sycophancy towards U.S. under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Policy of Sycophancy towards U.S. under Fire
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- One of the most serious crimes committed by the present ruling quarters in south Korea is that they sold off the destiny and sovereignty of the nation to foreign forces lock, stock and barrel, pursuant to their unprecedented policy of sycophancy towards the U.S., says Rodong Sinmun Monday in a bylined article.
					It goes on:
					
					The Lee regime's above-said policy resulted in making south Korea totally dependent on the U.S. in the aspects of politics, economy and military affairs and bringing the north-south relations to a total collapse by making them subject to south Korea's ties with the U.S.
					
					It is due to its enforcement of the policy in the last four years of office that the dignity and sovereignty of the south Korean people have been wantonly violated and the politics, economy and people's living put into mayhem while all kinds of social evils got rampant in the society.
					
					"No nukes, opening and 3 000 dollars" advertised by the Lee group as its "policy towards the north" is, in essence, a clear indication of the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					
					The puppet forces, utterly indifferent to the nation's destiny, have frequently staged war maneuvers such as the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle and Ulji Freedom Guardian, extremely escalating the danger of a nuclear war on the Korean Peninsula and throwing the people into constant unrest.
					
					They went the lengths of orchestrating such hideous military provocations as the "Cheonan" warship case and the Yonphyong Island shelling incident in collusion with the U.S., bringing to light their true colors as war servants of foreign forces.
					
					The anti-DPRK smear campaign staged by the Lee group over its "human rights" issue since the outset of its office is a product of the puppet forces' pro-U.S. stand that "the issue of south-north relations should be dealt with within the framework of the ties with the U.S." 
					
					This disgusting policy of the group has brought the inter-Korean relations to a total collapse and thrown a stumbling block in the way of achieving full sovereignty of the nation.
					
					As long as the Lee group is allowed to stay in power, it is absolutely impossible for the south Koreans to exercise their national dignity and sovereignty nor is it possible to achieve peace and reunification.

articles.title: S. Korean Police under Fire for Justifying Their Suppression of Workers' Strike
articles.content:
S. Korean Police under Fire for Justifying Their Suppression of Workers' Strike
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Various circles of south Korea on March 13 launched actions to denounce the puppet Police Agency for justifying the harsh crackdown on the strike of the workers of Ssangryong Motors.
					The Ssangryong Motors Trade Union, the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions, the Federation of Metal Industrial Workers Unions and other labor organizations and human rights organizations held a press conference outside the building of the agency.
					
					The organizations accused the agency of describing the police crackdown in 2009 as the "most successful" of the actions taken over the cases in recent three years.
					
					They condemned the murderers for being pleased with the death of workers.
					
					At the end of the press conference, six representatives including the branch head of the Ssangryong Motors Trade Union made an attempt to meet with the director of the agency to hand a written protest to him.  Police, however, blocked them and walked them off. Infuriated by this, workers and human rights activists launch a sit-in strike all at once.
					
					That day the Solidarity for Social Progress in a statement condemned the agency for praising its policemen's bloody action.
					
					The statement demanded the agency make an apology to the unionists of Ssangryong Motors and their families and set free the arrested workers immediately.

articles.title: Election Rigging Will Never Be Allowed: S. Korean Organization
articles.content:
Election Rigging Will Never Be Allowed: S. Korean Organization
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification on March 15 issued a statement titled "We will never allow election rigging".
					52 years have passed since the Syngman Rhee dictatorial forces staged the March 15 election through all kinds of frauds and swindles, bribery and high-handed actions, lashing the people into fury, the statement said.
					
					The strong public resistance against the fraudulent election led to the April 19 uprising, finally ousting the dictator, it noted, and deplored:
					
					But those worshipping dictator Syngman Rhee are in power in south Korea at present.
					
					The present conservative group is working hard to repeat the March 15 fraudulent election in a bid to stay in power, it said, adding they should never allow this.
					
					The hearts of the people are burning with the will to eliminate the dictatorship at a time when the remnants of the "Yusin" dictatorship are raising their heads, it stressed.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Noble Personality Praised
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Noble Personality Praised
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Families of Koreans in China and Chinese people related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle were deeply moved by the noble personality of leader Kim Jong Il, who pursued the politics of love and trust in the people.
					Feng Yila, daughter of Feng Zhongyun of China related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, said that Kim Jong Il was a great man with warm humanity.  
					
					Kim Jong Il took warm care of Feng Zhongyun's children, valuing the blood-sealed ties established by President Kim Il Sung with her parents during the anti-Japanese war, she said, adding:
					
					Indeed, Kim Jong Il was an incarnation of humanity.
					
					Kim Myong Ae, a daughter-in-law of Kim Sun Ok who was a Korean woman in China related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, said that Kim Jong Il was a kind-hearted father of the people. She noted:
					
					Kim Jong Il made sure that the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong and the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery were built splendidly so that martyrs might always be remembered.
					
					This is an expression of his profound love and trust in the martyrs and their bereaved families.
					
					Chai Long, a great grandson of Chai Shiying who was Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, stressed:
					
					We have received boundless love and benevolence from Kim Jong Il.
					
					We keenly realized that he was identical to Kim Il Sung.
					
					He took deep care of us as Kim Il Sung did.
					
					I am sure that Kim Jong Il's revolutionary history will be given steady continuity as there is the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Minjok Thongsin Demands Abolition of Fascist Law
articles.content:
Minjok Thongsin Demands Abolition of Fascist Law
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Minjok Thongsin, an Internet newspaper of Koreans in the United States, on March 14 posted an article demanding the abolition of the south Korean "Security Law".
					The article recalled that the representative of Jaju Minbo, south Korea's progressive Internet newspaper, and its journalists are now subject to harsh suppression by the SL, anti-reunification fascist law.
					
					It is south Korea where speaking and writing about the reality of the society in the north as it is are branded as a crime, the article noted, querying where else exists such fascist law as SL?
					
					It held that the law depriving the people of all rights should be repealed without fail.

articles.title: Severe Punishment of "Saenuri" Party Called for in Japan
articles.content:
Severe Punishment of "Saenuri" Party Called for in Japan
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- "Minjok Sibo", a newspaper of Koreans in Japan, on March 15 in an article called for punishing the south Korean group of traitors.
					The article said "Saenuri" Party, the south Korean ruling party, which pursues an anti-DPRK hostile policy should be punished without fail and a solid foundation for peace and reunification should be laid.
					
					Park Geun-hye, chairwoman of the Emergency Measure Committee of the "Saenuri" Party, is busy praising her father Park Chung-hee's "Yusin" dictatorship to the sky and keen to revive it, the article said, adding that it should never be allowed.
					
					It accused her of supporting the present "government" in its hostile policy towards fellow countrymen though it has pushed the north-south relations to the brink of war and stubbornly opposed the abolition of the "Security Law."
					
					It is impossible to radically repair the inner-Korean relations now at the worst phase as long as Park, typical conservative politician pursuing north-south confrontation, is allowed to stay in the political arena, it observed, and went on:
					
					The "Saenuri" Party was grown from the roots of Park Chung-hee's "Republican Party", Chun Doo Hwan's "Democratic Justice Party", Roh Tae Woo's "Democratic Liberal Party" and Lee Myung Bak's "Grand National Party." 
					
					It called on the people to mete out a stern judgment to the "Saenuri" Party in the April parliamentary election as it has pursued an unpopular, anti-reunification and undemocratic policy as a lackey under the dictatorial rule.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Website of Nigerian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Website of Nigerian Organization
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The full text of President Kim Il Sung's work "Preventing War and Preserving Peace Are the Burning Tasks of Mankind" was posted on the website of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea on March 13.
					The work, published on September 6, 1986, deals with the importance of the issue of defusing the tension and the danger of a nuclear war on the Korean Peninsula and its root cause and tasks for preventing a new world war, a thermonuclear war, and defending peace.

articles.title: Bangladeshi Party Leader Expresses Solidarity with DPRK's Will to Punish Lee Myung Bak Group
articles.content:
Bangladeshi Party Leader Expresses Solidarity with DPRK's Will to Punish Lee Myung Bak Group
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Garib Newaz, president of the Bangladesh People's League, released a statement on March 13 expressing solidarity with the will of the army and people of the DPRK to mercilessly punish south Korea's Lee Myung Bak group of traitors.
					The U.S. and south Korea are staging the DPRK-targeted dangerous joint military exercises, creating extreme tension and the danger of war on the Korean Peninsula, the statement said.
					
					The south Korean authorities' acts of hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, in particular, are driving the situation on the Korean Peninsula into an uncontrollable phase, it noted, and went on: This is lashing all the service personnel and people of the DPRK into fury.
					
					The south Korean authorities should face up to the trend of the times and act with discretion.
					
					The Bangladesh People's League positively supports the army and people of the DPRK in their just cause of improving the inter-Korean relations and ensuring regional peace and security.

articles.title: Ethiopian Organization Blasts Lee Myung Bak Group for Hurting Dignity of DPRK's Supreme Leadership
articles.content:
Ethiopian Organization Blasts Lee Myung Bak Group for Hurting Dignity of DPRK's Supreme Leadership
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea released a statement on March 8 denouncing the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors for hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					The statement vehemently condemned the Lee Myung Bak group of south Korea for its hideous provocations against the DPRK, going against the unanimous aspiration and desire of the Korean people and world people for peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il are great men always deeply revered by progressive mankind as they founded and developed the immortal Juche idea, making great contributions to global independence, the statement said, adding:
					
					The Lee Myung Bak group defamed and insulted the great men whom the Korean people and the Juche idea followers of the world are looking up to, while staging war maneuvers for aggression in league with foreign forces, far from sharing sorrow with compatriots over a great loss. The group's crimes are sparking off our towering resentment. 
					
					The present developments go to prove that the Lee group is, indeed, the enemy of the nation and the root cause of war as it has sought tension only after pushing the inter-Korean relations to the worst phase. 
					
					The Lee group will no longer be pardoned by the Korean people but face a stern judgment of history. 
					
					We will always stand by the just cause of the Korean people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk's Revolutionary Life Praised by Peruvian Figure
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk's Revolutionary Life Praised by Peruvian Figure
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The brilliant revolutionary life and feats of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese war hero, were praised by Teresa Otiniano, chairwoman of the Peruvian Association for the Study of Revolutionary Activities of Comrade Kim Jong Suk.
					In her speech at the meeting of women in Lima on March 13 marking the March 8 International Women's Day she said:
					
					Kim Jong Suk performed distinguished feats in the anti-Japanese armed struggle for the liberation of Korea led by President Kim Il Sung and the building of new Korea after the liberation.
					
					Kim Jong Suk was an anti-Japanese war hero and a great pioneer of the Korean women's movement.
					
					She was a great paragon of the women of Peru and the world progressive women struggling for social justice and equality.
					
					Teresa Otiniano underlined the need to boost the friendship and solidarity between the Peruvian and Korean women.

articles.title: Ecuadorian President Expresses Solidarity with Cuba in Its Struggle against U.S.
articles.content:
Ecuadorian President Expresses Solidarity with Cuba in Its Struggle against U.S.
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Ecuadorian President Rafael Correa announced on Thursday his refusal to participate in the Summit of the Americas, scheduled for April in Colombia, to protest against the U.S. stance to exclude Cuba.
					Speaking to the press in Turkey, Correa said he would not attend these summits, which are deprived of debates on the Latin American peoples' problems.

articles.title: Russian FM Urges U.S. to Provide Legal Assurances
articles.content:
Russian FM Urges U.S. to Provide Legal Assurances
Moscow, March 18 (KCNA) -- Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, in his speech at a recent national conference, urged the U.S. to give legal assurances over the missile defense system.
					He said if the U.S. does not intend to modify anything in its plan for MD, it should give Russia assurances that it is not targeted against the latter. 
					
					Noting that there is a serious problem in the Russia-U.S. relations, he said that whether the U.S. can address the concerns of Russia or not will be a barometer for the bilateral relations.

articles.title: Iran Will Pass through Sanctions Successfully: Algerian Official
articles.content:
Iran Will Pass through Sanctions Successfully: Algerian Official
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The Algerian head of the Algeria-Iran parliamentary friendship group said the Iranian nation will strongly leave the sanctions behind. 
					The head believed that the imposed sanctions on the Islamic Republic by no means could create obstacles in the way of the country's progress and development.
					
					The head hoped the Algeria-Iran parliamentary group would prepare the ground for expansion of all-out cooperation between the two nations.

articles.title: PLO Condemns Israel
articles.content:
PLO Condemns Israel
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Israel has carried some airstrikes in the Gaza Strip despite cease-fire to ignite a regional fighting, a Palestinian official said Thursday.
					"Israel wants to separate Gaza from the West Bank in order to keep it out of any Palestinian entity," Yasser Abed Rabbo, a member of the Executive Committee of Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO), told Voice of Palestine radio.

articles.title: Belarus Bans Return of EU Ambassadors in Retaliation for Sanctions
articles.content:
Belarus Bans Return of EU Ambassadors in Retaliation for Sanctions
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Belarus would not allow European Union (EU) ambassadors to return to Minsk if the bloc keeps on threatening the country with new sanctions, said the Foreign Ministry on Thursday.
					The EU expanded on Feb. 28 the list of Belarusian officials subject to visa and economic sanctions over Belarus' human rights issue.

articles.title: Cuba Supports Independent Palestinian State
articles.content:
Cuba Supports Independent Palestinian State
Havana, March 18 (KCNA) -- Cuba reaffirmed its support to the struggle of the Palestinian people to regain all their rights, including the establishment of their independent State with East Kuds as its capital, the Cuban Foreign Ministry informed in a communique on Thursday.

articles.title: Zimbabwe Not to Recognize ICC: Official
articles.content:
Zimbabwe Not to Recognize ICC: Official
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Zimbabwe will not legitimize the International Criminal Court (ICC) since it has deviated from the original function for which it was created for, a senior official said on Thursday.
					Zimbabwe's Justice and Legal Affairs Minister Patrick Chinamasa, who was attending the United Nations Human Rights Council in Geneva, Switzerland, made the remarks.
					
					State radio quoted Chinamasa as saying the big powers have compromised the international court by using it in a discriminatory manner to punish leaders from developing countries.
					
					Criticizing Western powers' interference in Third World countries, Chinamasa also blasted those who have imposed sanctions on Zimbabwe, urging them to remove them without further delays.

articles.title: Lanzamiento de "Kwangmyongsong-3" no viola acuerdo RPDC-EE.UU.
articles.content:
Lanzamiento de "Kwangmyongsong-3" no viola acuerdo RPDC-EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 19 de marzo (ACNC) -- En estos dias, los renegados surcoreanos libran una absurda campana mediatica en torno al lanzamiento en abril proximo de "Kwangmyongsong-3", satelite artificial de observacion de la Tierra por la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					Solo el dia 17, se divulgaron varias versiones encaminadas a estorbar las negociaciones RPDC-EE.UU., tales como "el Norte de Corea convierte en papel mojado a los 15 dias su acuerdo con EE.UU." (Dong-A Ilbo), "Es igual a violar el acuerdo rubricado  en las conversaciones de alto nivel RPDC-EE.UU. antes de que se secaran las firmas" (Kukmin Ilbo) y "Es la voluntad de tomar el control en las futuras negociaciones" (KBS).
					
					En el fondo de esa demagogia de que el satelite "'Kwangmyongsong-3' es un ICBM (misil balistico intercontinental)" y violacion sobre el acuerdo de las conversaciones de alto nivel RPDC-EE.UU. del 29 de febrero, esta escondido el objetivo politico del "poder" de Lee Myung Bak actualmente en agonia.
					
					La camarilla de Lee tiene mucho miedo al dialogo y negociaciones RPDC-EE.UU., pensando en que si marchan bien esas platicas, puede ser abandonada por su amo gringo y excluida del debate de problemas regionales.
					
					En estos momentos, el anuncio de programado lanzamiento de satelite artificial de la RPDC significo para ellos la oportunidad propicia para instigar a los conservadores norteamericanos a frustrar el dialogo con la RPDC.
					
					Lo comprueban los rumores difundidos por ella de que el lanzamiento de satelite "es un proyecto provocativo y contradictorio al acuerdo Norte de Corea-EE.UU." y "estan en duda las posibilidades de dialogo y negociaciones".
					
					Es realmente un truco barato de los estupidos.
					
					Evidentemente dicho, el lanzamiento de "Kwangmyongsong-3" no tiene nada que ver con el acuerdo RPDC-EE.UU.
					
					La RPDC decidio suspender temporalmente, en lo que vayan las conversaciones fructiferas, las pruebas nucleares, el lanzamiento de misiles de largo alcance y el enriquecimiento de uranio en Nyongbyon y permitir el monitoreo de la Agencia Internacional de Energia Atomica sobre esa ultima actividad.
					
					Partiendo del derecho legitimo de todos los paises a usar el espacio con fines pacificos, anuncio su plan de lanzamiento de nuevo satelite y aviso los datos correspondientes a las organizaciones internacionales pertinentes segun el reglamento y procedimiento internacionales.
					
					No hay nada cuestionable en ese plan que tiene el noble proposito de consolidar la base de construccion de un Estado prospero socialista en Corea y contribuir a la coprosperidad de la nacion y la humanidad entera, al situar a la etapa mas alta la ciencia y tecnologia de punta del pais mediante el lanzamiento de nuevo satelite.
					
					El lanzamiento de satelite artificial de usos practicos y el de misil de largo alcance son temas apartes.
					
					Entonces, ?como explicarian los titeres surcoreanos y otras fuerzas hostiles a la RPDC la puesta en orbita de mas de 100 aparatos espaciales, como promedio anual en el mundo, mediante el empleo de cohetes transportadores?
					
					Hay que tener alerta a los disparates de los titeres surcoreanos.
					
					Anteriormente, las fuerzas hostiles habian empujado a la RPDC a poseer las armas nucleares al frustrar el dialogo entre la RPDC y EE.UU. sacando absurdamente el tema de las "sospechas de enriquecimiento de uranio" y exacerbar al extremo la situacion.
					
					Seria mejor no repetir esa leccion historica.
					
					La RPDC sabe garantizar por si sola su soberania y derecho a la existencia.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim recorre Complejo Siderurgico Kim Chaek
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim recorre Complejo Siderurgico Kim Chaek
Pyongyang, 19 de marzo (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Choe Yong Rim averiguo el dia 16 en el terreno el estado de produccion y renovacion tecnica del Complejo Siderurgico Kim Chaek, que desempena un papel muy importante en el desarrollo de la industria metalurgica del pais.
					Los obreros del Complejo se empenan por acoger con elevado entusiasmo politico y brillantes exitos laborales el centenario de natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung y la Conferencia del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					
					Concluyeron en alto nivel la renovacion tecnica de primera etapa del moldeador continuo en lingotes e instalaron el equipo compensador de la potencia reactiva.
					
					Ahora estan asegurando el funcionamiento pleno de alto horno no.2, mientras impulsan la renovacion tecnica de la parte de calentamiento del proceso de produccion de laminado en caliente.
					
					El premier recorrio campo de reparacion de altos hornos no.2 y 3 e infundio animo a los obreros.
					
					Se convoco la reunion consultiva de los funcionarios de la rama correspondiente, donde se hizo balance del estado de materializacion del legado del Dirigente Kim Jong Il y produccion de acero, y de suministro de materias primas y combustibles para el funcionamiento sucesivo de altos hornos.
					
					Se tomaron las medidas practicas para resolver los problemas surgidos en priorizar el suministro de materias primas y combustibles y combinar la produccion con la ciencia y tecnica.
					
					Por ultimo, fueron discutidas las medidas para hacer bien la planificacion de produccion y suministro y alcanzar la renovacion tecnica universal del proceso de produccion de laminados en caliente o en frio.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim recorre varios dominios de ciudad de Chongjin
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim recorre varios dominios de ciudad de Chongjin
Pyongyang, 19 de marzo (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Choe Yong Rim dirigio en el terreno los dias 16 y 17 varios dominios de la ciudad de Chongjin de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte, incluidos el Complejo de Maquinas de Minas de Carbon de Ranam, la Aceria de Chongjin, el Combinado de Alimentos de Susongchon y la Granja Cooperativa de Namsok del municipio de Songphyong. 
					Recorriendo  varias unidades, donde se avivan las llamaradas de Hamnam, averiguo en detalles el estado de produccion de instalaciones pedidas y materiales de hierro y acero, la renovacion tecnica, el aseguramiento de calidad de alimentos y los preparativos para la faena agricola de este ano.
					
					Los funcionarios y trabajadores de la citada ciudad registran gran auge en la produccion y construccion de acuerdo con la decision tomada ante el feretro del fallecido Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					En las unidades concernientes, el premier coreano estimulo el empeno laboral de los trabajadores y realizo el trabajo organizativo economico para aumentar la produccion.
					
					A base del estudio de la labor economica de la ciudad de Chongjin, Choe convoco la reunion consultiva de los funcionarios correspondientes.
					
					Se abordaron en la ocasion los temas practicos por convertir magnificamente Chongjin en una ciudad moderna y mejorar las condiciones de vida de los habitantes.
					
					Tambien fueron tomadas las medidas para anteponer el plan de suministro de materiales al de produccion, organizar racionalmente el suministro de combustible, materias primas y la electricidad, e incrementar la cantidad de transporte de cargas mediante la modernizacion ferroviaria.

articles.title: ACNC comenta palabras imprudentes de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
ACNC comenta palabras imprudentes de Lee Myung Bak
Pyongyang, 19 de marzo (ACNC) -- El traidor Lee Myung Bak se porta groseramente censurando el proximo lanzamiento de satelite artificial "Kwangmyongsong-3" de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					La reunion urgente de ministros de diplomacia y seguridad, auspiciada el dia 19 en Chongwadae (Casa Azul) por el, califico de "severa provocacion" el lanzamiento de dicho satelite artificial y expuso abiertamente el intento de internacionalizarlo en ocasion de la "Cumbre de Seguridad Nuclear".
					
					Tal conducta de Lee, primer lacayo de guerra nuclear de Estados Unidos, deviene acto de traicion a la nacion que recurre locamente a la confrontacion fratricida prestando suma importancia a las fuerzas foraneas mas que la nacion.
					
					En la actualidad, todos los coreanos internos y externos apoyan activamente la noticia del proximo lanzamiento de satelite artificial considerandola como gran jubilo nacional.
					
					El lanzamiento de "Kwangmyongsong-3" deviene un momento historico demostrando que la ciencia y tecnologia espaciales de la RPDC han dado un paso mas grande hacia adelante y su poderio ha llegado a la etapa mas alta.
					
					En tal momento, solo el renegado Lee Myung Bak se porta de manera imprudente para danar a sus connacionales en contubernio con las fuerzas extranjeras so pretexto de "hacer frente mediante la cooperacion internacional", porque a traves del lanzamiento de satelite artificial se intensificara mas el prestigio internacional de la RPDC y la opinion publica de los surcoreanos se dirigiera hacia el Norte (de Corea).
					
					Esto sera duro golpe a la banda de Lee Myung Bak tendente a aplastar a su connacional RPDC apoyandose en  las fuerzas extranjeras.
					
					Los renegados surcoreanos intentaron lanzar dos veces satelites artificiales por ayuda foranea, pero fracasaron. Si lo hubieran solicitado a la RPDC, les serian mas buenos.
					
					Si tienen en lo minimo el espiritu nacional, no cometeran tal acto traidor. 
					
					Lee Myung Bak cuestiona el lanzamiento de satelite artificial de la RPDC en la reunion internacional, lo cual vuelve a demostrar fehacientemente que el es el traidor proyanqui y maniaco de enfrentamiento fratricida que no toma en consideracion la dignidad y el interes de la nacion.
					
					Para vivir en paz, toda la nacion coreana debe aniquilar cuanto antes al traidor Lee, causa raigal de las desgracias y calamidades.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun comenta postura conflictiva de Jong Sung Jo
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun comenta postura conflictiva de Jong Sung Jo
Pyongyang, 19 de marzo (ACNC) -- El traidor Jong Sung Jo, jefe de la Junta de Jefes de Estado Mayor del ejercito titere surcoreano, visito hace unos dias la comandancia operacional de las fuerzas aereas en Phyongthaek.
					En esa ocasion, ordeno que "despeguen de inmediato, si el Norte comete la provocacion, para atacar con precision el foco de provocacion y a las fuerzas de asistencia", y sobrevolo una hora el Mar Oeste de Corea a bordo de un caza tipo "F-15K".
					
					Su comportamiento tan belicoso recuerda el ultimo pataleo de los condenados a la muerte, ridiculiza el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual divulgado la vispera y prosigue:
					
					Jong es el maniaco de guerra que no quiere ceder el primer lugar en la belicosidad.
					
					Al orquestar un grave choque armado mediante una provocacion intencional, el quiere ampliarlo a la guerra total contra la RPDC.
					
					Hay que liquidar cuanto antes a el y otros compinches de Lee Myung Bak, que toman una postura cada vez mas desafiante, lejos de arrepentirse o pedir disculpas por su gran crimen de ofender la maxima dignidad de la nacion coreana, el cual no sera expiado nunca ante la historia y la nacion.
					
					A pesar de sus desesperados esfuerzos por buscar la salida, ellos no podran salir del abismo de arruinamiento.
					
					En un futuro cercano, Jong Sung Jo se arrepentira de su extremado belicismo que llevaria a la destruccion a si mismo y su camarilla.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun revela politica proyanqui de autoridades surcoreanas
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun revela politica proyanqui de autoridades surcoreanas
Pyongyang, 19 de marzo (ACNC) -- Uno de los tremendos crimenes perpetrados por de la banda del traidor surcoreano Lee Myung Bak durante 4 anos de su mandato fue el que vendio por completo a las fuerzas extranjeras la dignidad y la soberania de la nacion con la politica proyanqui nunca vista en la historia.
					Asi revela el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual difundido este lunes y continua:
					
					Debido a tal politica grandes potencias, el Sur de Corea fue subyugado a EE.UU. de manera  politica, economica y militar y las relaciones intercoreanas fueron frustradas por completo convirtiendose en una cosa dependiente del imperio.
					
					Y la dignidad y la soberania de los habitantes surcoreanos fueron violadas indiscriminadamente y en la sociedad surcoreana reinan los males de toda indole, y se hallan en caos la politica, la economia y la vida de los habitantes.
					
					La esencia de la "politica sobre el Norte" de  la banda de Lee, cuyo nucleo es la "desnuclearizacion, la apertura y 3 mil dolares" refleja enteramente la politica hostil anti-RPDC de EE.UU.
					
					Los titeres aumentan el peligro de guerra nuclear en la Peninsula Coreana y llevan a los habitantes a la inseguridad permanente librando de continuo los ejercicios belicos de gran o pequeno tamanos como "Key Resolve", "Foal Eagle" y "Ulji Freedom Guardian" sin tomar en consideracion el destino de la nacion coreana.
					
					No satisfechos con esto, perpetraron las graves provocaciones militares en contubernio con EE.UU. como el caso del hundimiento de la corbeta "Cheonan" y el de canonazos en la isla Yonphyong.
					
					La campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC perpetrada por ella desde los primeros dias de su mandato es el resultado de la posicion servil a EE.UU. de los titeres surcoreanos de "tratar en medio de las relaciones con EE.UU. el problema de las relaciones Sur-Norte".
					
					Debido a esta bochornosa politica proyanqui de la banda de Lee las relaciones intercoreanas fueron frustradas totalmente y se crean grandes dificultades  en realizar la soberania completa de la nacion.
					
					Sin eliminar a la banda de Lee Myung Bak los habitantes surcoreanos no pueden ejercer para siempre la dignidad nacional y la soberania ni lograr la paz ni la reunificacion de la patria.
